DOCNAME: CASE OF LE CALVEZ v. FRANCE
CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award;Costs and expenses partial award - domestic proceedings;Costs and expenses partial award - Convention proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE Mr PERSON was recruited to ORG as an agricultural technician . He became established on DATE .

CARDINAL . Further to a request made by the applicant on DATE , the High Commissioner of GPE ( “ the High Commissioner ” ) decided on DATE to grant him leave of absence for DATE from DATE . That decision was taken in accordance with LAW no . CARDINAL of CARDINAL DATE embodying ORG ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) . By a decision of CARDINAL DATE the applicant was , at his own request , given a further CARDINAL years’ leave of absence from DATE , and that period was extended until DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Minister of Agriculture and Forestry placed Mr Le Calvez , at the latter ’s request , on secondment ( détachement ) for a period of DATE on DATE . He was assigned first to ORG for the département of Côtes d’Armor and then , from DATE , at his own request , to ORG at GPE .

CARDINAL . After ORG issued an opinion on CARDINAL DATE recommending that the applicant should not be retained in that department , the Minister of Agriculture informed him that he had decided to terminate his secondment to the corps of ORG technicians and to request his reinstatement as a technician in the GPE agricultural service .
CARDINAL . By an order of CARDINAL DATE the Minister terminated the secondment with effect from DATE .
CARDINAL . In a letter of DATE the High Commissioner invited the applicant either to rejoin his original department or to request leave of absence .

CARDINAL . On DATE , that is to say DATE , the applicant had been declared unfit for work by a doctor and had sought sickness benefit from ORG Scheme ( Mutualité Fonction Publique ) , which sent him a letter on DATE in the following terms :

“ ... we confirm that we are unable to pay you sickness benefit for the period of absence from work due to illness that has been prescribed for you from DATE to CARDINAL DATE . This is because you are an established civil servant . Sickness benefit for persons in that category is paid by the authorities ... ”

That DATE the insurers sent a letter to ORG confirming that the applicant had been absent from work owing to illness since DATE . They pointed out that as his service with ORG had been terminated with effect from DATE , the applicant ought to be able to claim compensation , either through the civil service or through the social - security scheme for civil servants .

CARDINAL . Earlier , on CARDINAL DATE , Mr FAC had informed the relevant authorities that he did not wish to return to GPE before ORG ruled on an application he had made to have the order of CARDINAL DATE quashed ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) .

CARDINAL . As a result , the High Commissioner , in a decision of DATE , sent the applicant on leave of absence , initially for DATE from DATE to DATE , which was renewed from DATE and ended on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( COTOREP ) of ORG for the département of Finistère refused the applicant disabled - worker status and accordingly ruled that he was fit for work .
CARDINAL . On DATE the High Commissioner wrote to the applicant in the following terms :

“ Please find enclosed CARDINAL certified copies of the decision to keep you on leave of absence from DATE to CARDINAL DATE inclusive , at which point you will have used up all your entitlement to CARDINAL years’ leave of absence under LAW no . CARDINAL of CARDINAL DATE . We have sent your application for reinstatement to the organisations likely to have a vacant budgetary post available that would allow you to be reinstated ... ”
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant applied to ORG for a stay of execution of the order of DATE terminating his secondment .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed that application on the ground that the harm that would result from execution of the order was not such as to justify ordering a stay . The PERSON d’Etat upheld that decision on DATE .
CARDINAL . The applicant had also applied to ORG on DATE to quash the decision of DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed that application on the following grounds :
Termination of the secondment

Firstly , section CARDINAL bis of Law no . CARDINAL of DATE , as inserted by LAW no . CARDINAL of CARDINAL DATE , provides : ‘ Notwithstanding any provision to the contrary in the special rules governing civil servants subject to PERSON no . CARDINAL of DATE making provisions governing the civil service or in the special rules on local government staff and posts covered by PERSON no . CARDINAL of DATE making provisions relating to local government service , civil servants who are members of ORG may be seconded to departments and posts in central or local government authorities of a level equivalent to those to which they belong and may be appointed to them permanently’ . While these provisions allow civil servants from GPE to be seconded and to be appointed to equivalent departments in central or local government service , they nevertheless do not derogate from the principle that secondment may be terminated ...

Secondly , it is clear from the documents in the case file that , having been informed by letter of CARDINAL DATE of the decision to terminate the secondment ... , the ORG ’s delegate in GPE asked the applicant ... to say whether he wished to be given leave of absence or to be reinstated in his original department . It follows that Mr FAC can not validly argue that his reinstatement was refused after the leave of absence that had allegedly prevented his reinstatement earlier or that his original department had not agreed to that measure .

Lastly , the documents in the case file do not show that the decision to terminate his secondment was taken for reasons other than the interests of the service or was the result of an error of judgment .
Refusal of appointment

Although the decision in issue terminating his secondment must be regarded as also constituting a decision not to appoint him , the applicant can not validly maintain that the authorities were obliged to appoint him pursuant to section CARDINAL bis of the Law of DATE , since those provisions , as explained above , create no obligation on the part of the original department .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant appealed against that decision of ORG to ORG .
CARDINAL . The Minister of Agriculture lodged a pleading on DATE , to which the applicant replied on DATE .
CARDINAL . In a judgment of CARDINAL DATE ORG affirmed the judgment of the court below .

CARDINAL . Meanwhile , in an application registered at ORG registry on CARDINAL DATE , the applicant had informed that court that he “ consider[ed ] himself to be the victim of moral , intellectual and professional defamation and would like legal advice ” .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG gave the following judgment :
“ In his application Mr Le Calvez seeks an order quashing the decision of DATE to transfer him to ORG .

That decision was taken following a request by Mr Le Calvez on DATE . Furthermore , the only grounds put forward by the applicant relate to the unlawfulness of the decision of CARDINAL DATE terminating his secondment and are ineffective [ against ] the decision of CARDINAL DATE .
It follows from the foregoing that the application must be dismissed . ”

CARDINAL . In the meantime , on DATE , the applicant had sent the High Commissioner a letter DATE to which he received no reply – requesting “ information on his administrative position ” and payment of sickness benefit and compensation for loss of salary with effect from CARDINAL DATE . He argued that he had been obliged by ill health to be absent from work since DATE and was entitled to sickness benefit under LAW .
CARDINAL . On DATE Mr Le Calvez lodged an application with ORG to quash the High Commissioner ’s implicit refusal to pay him sickness benefit and compensation for loss of salary .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was granted legal aid .
CARDINAL . The High Commissioner lodged a defence , which was registered at the court registry on DATE and served on the applicant ’s lawyer on DATE . In his defence the High Commissioner submitted :

Since DATE Mr FAC has regularly sent the territory ’s administrative authorities notifications of extensions of absence from work due to illness ( CARDINAL have been received to date ) . With a letter of DATE he sent his department a medical certificate in which PERSON certified that he would not be able to return to his post in GPE for health reasons ...

At the end of his period of secondment Mr Le Calvez chose , for personal reasons , not to return to GPE . The territory ’s administrative authorities have regularised his position by sending him on leave of absence , in accordance with the provisions of ORG Code , with effect from DATE .

Civil servants who are on leave of absence do not normally receive any salary and are no longer entitled to benefit under the social - security scheme for civil servants . Accordingly , Mr FAC can not claim any remuneration or any benefit .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG , to whom the case had been referred , advised that he had been informed by the GPE authorities that they had no vacant post for the applicant . As to the question of paying sickness benefit to the applicant during his illness , he wrote :

“ ... I have been informed that he was not entitled to paid sick - leave as ORG did not have to remunerate Mr Le Calvez after DATE . The GPE authorities , who had been obliged to send him on compulsory leave of absence , could not pay him a salary either . For my part , I have to record that a friendly settlement , taking into account the considerations of fairness that I put to those to whom I have spoken , has been prevented by a strict application of the relevant regulations . ”
CARDINAL . The applicant ’s lawyer lodged a pleading on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the application on the following grounds :

“ Mr FAC , an agricultural technician in the agricultural service of ORG , was seconded to ORG for a DATE period commencing on DATE . By a decision of CARDINAL DATE the Minister of ORG terminated his secondment with effect from DATE . In a letter of CARDINAL DATE the ORG ’s delegate , the High Commissioner of GPE , invited Mr FAC to inform him within DATE whether he wished to be given leave of absence or to be reinstated in his original department . As he did not return to GPE , it was decided on DATE to send him on DATE leave of absence as from CARDINAL DATE to DATE inclusive , a period which was extended by decisions of CARDINAL DATE and CARDINAL DATE . Mr ORG application must be regarded as being for an order quashing the implied refusal of the Government ’s delegate , the High Commissioner of GPE , to pay him sickness benefit and compensation for loss of salary for DATE on DATE .

Although from DATE Mr FAC sent the GPE administrative authorities a succession of notifications of absence of work due to illness , the documents in the case file do not show that he was given sick - leave or that he had been given leave of absence for health reasons . In the circumstances Mr ORG Calvez can not validly rely on Articles L. CARDINAL - CARDINAL and NORP CARDINAL of the Social Security Code or on Articles CARDINAL and CARDINAL of ORG Code and is not entitled to claim any compensation in respect of salary or any benefit under the social - security scheme for civil servants . ”
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant appealed against that judgment to ORG .

CARDINAL . NORP The Minister for Overseas Departments and Territories lodged a pleading on DATE in which he indicated that the High Commissioner of GPE was the person who had responsibility for the matters before the court .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant wrote to the President of ORG asking for his CARDINAL pending cases to be joined ( see paragraphs CARDINAL above ) . He explained that all his job applications had been unsuccessful and that it was not possible for him to be reinstated in his original department as there was no vacant budgetary post in GPE . He added that if he was granted financial assistance , he would be able to go to GPE in order to find out what the possibilities of reinstatement or redeployment were .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG registered the High Commissioner ’s defence , in which he submitted :
“ ... while Mr ORG application includes some factual submissions , for the most part irrelevant to the present case , it does not on the other hand contain any legal submissions ...

At the end of his period of secondment Mr Le Calvez chose , for personal reasons , not to return to GPE . The territory ’s administrative authorities regularised his position by sending him on leave of absence , in accordance with the provisions of ORG Code , with effect from DATE . Civil servants who are on leave of absence do not normally receive any salary and are no longer entitled to benefit under the social - security scheme for civil servants . Accordingly , Mr Le PERSON can not claim any remuneration or any benefit . His application for an order quashing the authorities’ refusal to pay him sickness benefit is therefore unfounded .
CARDINAL . The applicant lodged a pleading on DATE .

CARDINAL . In a letter of DATE to which he received no reply – he enquired about the progress of the proceedings before ORG . In a letter of CARDINAL DATE he again asked the President of ORG whether it would be possible to join the CARDINAL cases referred to above ( see paragraph CARDINAL ) and expressed concern at the length of time that the consideration of his cases was taking . The court registrar replied on DATE that the cases were not ready for trial as the lawyer who had been assigned to represent Mr Le Calvez under the legal - aid scheme had not yet filed a pleading .
CARDINAL . According to the Government , that lawyer has since been disbarred .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant again enquired of the President of ORG as to the progress of the proceedings . On DATE his new lawyer lodged a pleading .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG informed the applicant that a hearing would be held in the CARDINAL cases in question ( see paragraph QUANTITY above ) in DATE .

CARDINAL . In a judgment of CARDINAL DATE ORG affirmed the judgment of the court below . It held that because the applicant was on leave of absence , he was not , by LAW ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) , entitled to the welfare benefits claimed . Furthermore , the court added that the provisions of LAW relied on by the applicant in support of his claims , namely Articles L. CARDINAL - CARDINAL and NORP CARDINAL - CARDINAL ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) , did not apply in his position either , as they concerned civil servants in post .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant appealed on points of law to the ORG d’Etat .
CARDINAL . The provisions of Decree no . CARDINAL of CARDINAL DATE issued by the High Commissioner and embodying ORG Code that are applicable in the case read as follows :
“ A civil servant is on leave of absence if he is no longer in his original department or service and ceases in that position to enjoy his promotion and pension rights . ”
“ Leave of absence shall be decided on by the head of the territory , either of his own motion or at the request of the person concerned ... ”

“ A civil servant may be compelled to take leave of absence only if he has exhausted his right to convalescence leave or extended sick - leave and is unable to resume his duties at DATE . Where compulsory leave of absence follows a period of sick - leave , the civil servant shall for DATE the salary he received when in post and all his family supplements . ”
“ Compulsory leave of absence shall not exceed DATE . It may be extended twice for the same length of time .

“ Leave of absence may be granted at a civil servant ’s request only in cases of accident or serious illness of a spouse or child or , exceptionally , after DATE service , for personal reasons or for research or studies of indisputable general interest . ”
“ Leave of absence at the civil servant ’s request shall not exceed DATE in duration . However , it may be extended twice for the same length of time . ”
“ A civil servant who is on leave of absence at his own request shall not be entitled to any remuneration ... ”

“ A civil servant who is on leave of absence at his own request must apply for reinstatement DATE before the expiration of the current period of leave . Reinstatement as of right is by way of appointment to CARDINAL of the first CARDINAL posts falling vacant where the leave of absence has not exceeded DATE in duration . ”
CARDINAL . Leave of absence is also governed by LAW of PERSON no . CARDINAL - CARDINAL of DATE making provisions relating to local government service , which provides :
“ A civil servant is on leave of absence if he is no longer in his original department or service and ceases in that position to enjoy his promotion and pension rights .

Leave of absence is either granted at the civil servant ’s request or is compulsory at the end of the leave referred to in subsections ( CARDINAL ) , ( CARDINAL ) and ( CARDINAL ) of LAW ( sick - leave of DATE , extended sick - leave of DATE and additional extended leave on health grounds ( congé de longue durée ) ) . A civil servant on leave of absence who successively refuses CARDINAL posts offered to him within the geographical area covered by his corps , post or service with a view to his reinstatement may be dismissed after consultation of the joint administrative committee . In other cases , if the leave of absence has not exceeded DATE , CARDINAL of the first CARDINAL posts falling vacant in the original authority or establishment must be offered to the civil servant .
CARDINAL . Articles D. CARDINAL - CARDINAL and PERSON of LAW provide :

“ In the event of illness or maternity , civil servants shall receive social - security benefits in kind on the conditions and at the rates in force at the health - insurance offices to which they are affiliated … ”

“ Civil servants in post to whom ORG Code applies ... and their families shall be entitled in the event of illness , maternity , invalidity or death to benefits at least equal to those payable under the social - security system . ”
